us.phonetic: /ɪkˈsɛs, ˈɛksɛs/, (n. ik ses′, ek′ses; adj., v. ek′ses, ik ses′)

example.eg: Most religions warn against the dangers of excess.
example.egtrans: 多数宗教都会警告教众无节制饮食的危害。

example.eg: We are slowly recovering from the excesses of Christmas.
example.egtrans: 我们慢慢地从圣诞期间无节制的狂欢中恢复。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 过度沉溺, 无节制的狂欢

example.eg: There was an excess of thousands of pounds.
The retailer is trying to sell off her excess stock.
example.egtrans: 经销商想卖掉她多余的库存。

example.eg: The children's excess energy was probably due to all the sweets they'd eaten.
example.egtrans: 孩子们的精力过度充沛，也许是因为吃的甜食太多。

us.phonetic: /ɪkˈsɛs, ˈɛksɛs/, (n. ik ses′, ek′ses; adj., v. ek′ses, ik ses′)

example.eg: If your luggage weighs more than 20 kilograms, you will have to pay the airline a fee for carrying excess baggage.
They say that in excess of 2000 people die from heart attacks annually.  This price is in excess of your original quote.
example.egtrans: 他们说每年有超过2000人死于心脏病。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 超过, 超出, 多于

example.eg: Drink when you're thirsty, but don't do it to excess.
